newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - Tuesday August 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - Tuesday August 27.

text.p: Following are the highlights of stories reported in the Irish press on Tuesday.

- An insurance company is to mount a direct challenge to the National Lottery through an insurance scheme. REHAB, which cares for the handicapped, is in a deal with an insurance company under which players would take out a policy based on their choice of numbers. If the numbers are chosen it would pay the player.
- Police have recovered a series of paedophile-type photographs in a child sex investigation. The prints feature a 13-year-old schoolgirl.
- The Irish Brokers Association has no scheme to compensate victims of mishandled investments. Commerce Minister Pat Rabbitte held talks with the body on complaints against Taylor Asset Managers.
- U.S. President Bill Clinton vowed tighter gun control as the Democratic convention began in Chicago.
- A marriage registrar has discovered that several summer couples were illegally married becaue they failed to provide necessary notice.
